intro: Mouriri panamensis, commonly known as the Panama mouriri, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Salicaceae, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Mouriri panamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
